in_ports.description: Output variable value to be tagged.
in_ports.name: IN

members.description: Tag to be applied to all packets passing through this node.
members.name: tag

in_ports.description: Output variable value to be filtered.
in_ports.name: IN

members.description: Tag to be used to filter packets passing through this node. If the packet's tag doesn't match this option, no packet will be sent in 'OUT' port. Otherwise a packet with only the float value will be sent.
members.name: tag

out_ports.description: Only the float value for packets that match the tag.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Learn output values based on input and output observation. Uses a fuzzy logic algorithm.

in_ports.description: Port for inputs sending float packets.
in_ports.name: IN_VAR

in_ports.description: Port for id inputs sending float packets.
in_ports.name: IN_ID_VAR

in_ports.description: Port for outputs sending tagged float packets.
in_ports.name: OUT_VAR

in_ports.description: Port for id outputs sending tagged float packets.
in_ports.name: OUT_ID_VAR

in_ports.description: Port used to trigger machine learning prediction.
in_ports.name: PREDICTION_TRIGGER

in_ports.description: Port used to trigger machine learning processing.
in_ports.name: TRIGGER

in_ports.description: Port used to save fuzzy data
in_ports.name: SAVE

in_ports.description: Port used to disable the learning process
in_ports.name: LEARN_DISABLED

in_ports.description: File to log sml read data and predicted outputs.
in_ports.name: DEBUG_FILE

in_ports.description: Reset the machine-learning node to its initial state. All the previous learned scenario will be erased.
in_ports.name: ERASE_KNOWLEDGE

types.name: machine-learning/fuzzy

members.description: Amount of reads without input changes to consider input stable. If zero, it's always considered stable.
members.name: stabilization_hits

members.description: Number of fuzzy terms to be created for each variable.
members.name: number_of_terms

members.description: The directory that the neural network data files will be saved/loaded
members.name: data_dir

types.description: Learn output values based on input and output observation. Uses neural network algorithm.

in_ports.description: Port for inputs sending float packets.
in_ports.name: IN_VAR

in_ports.description: Port for inputs sending float packets.
in_ports.name: IN_ID_VAR

in_ports.description: Port for outputs sending tagged float packets.
in_ports.name: OUT_VAR

in_ports.description: Port for id outputs sending tagged float packets.
in_ports.name: OUT_ID_VAR

in_ports.description: Port used to trigger machine learning prediction.
in_ports.name: PREDICTION_TRIGGER

in_ports.description: Port used to trigger machine learning processing.
in_ports.name: TRIGGER

in_ports.description: Port used to save neural network data
in_ports.name: SAVE

in_ports.description: Port used to disable the learning process
in_ports.name: LEARN_DISABLED

in_ports.description: File to log sml read data and predicted outputs.
in_ports.name: DEBUG_FILE

in_ports.description: Reset the machine-learning node to its initial state. All the previous learned scenario will be erased.
in_ports.name: ERASE_KNOWLEDGE

types.name: machine-learning/neural-network

members.description: Amount of reads without input changes to consider input stable. If zero, it's always considered stable.
members.name: stabilization_hits

members.description: Amound of initial observations necessary to first neural network training. If zero or negative, the default initial observation value will be used.
members.name: initial_required_observations

members.description: Desired mean squared error. It's the difference between the estimator and what is estimated. The neural network will try to reach this value. Higher values can be reached easily, requiring less time and processing on training phase. Also, it won't try to guess the output if the desired mse wasn't reached.
members.name: mse

members.description: Training algorithm to be used by the neural network. Supported algorithms are: 'rprop' - resilient backpropagation, and 'quickprop' - discrete pseudo-Newton method.
members.name: training_algorithm

members.default: sigmoid sigmoid_symmetric gaussian gaussian_symmetric elliot elliot_symmetric cos cos_symmetric sin sin_symmetric
members.description: Activation functions that may be used for neural network. It'll try to use all of these functions to get the best one for its observations. Supported activation functions are: sigmoid sigmoid_symmetric gaussian gaussian_symmetric elliot elliot_symmetric cos cos_symmetric sin sin_symmetric. It's possible to set more than one, separeted by space. By default all of them are considered candidates. Reducing this set will reduce processing on training phase.
members.name: activation_functions

members.description: The directory that the neural network data files will be saved/loaded
members.name: data_dir

types.description: Learn output values based on input and output observation. Uses a fuzzy logic algorithm.

in_ports.name: IN

in_ports.name: IN_PREDICT

in_ports.name: DEBUG_FILE

in_ports.name: ERASE_KNOWLEDGE

in_ports.name: LEARN_DISABLED

members.name: stabilization_hits

members.description: Number of fuzzy terms to be created for each variable.
members.name: number_of_terms

members.description: The directory that the fuzzy data files will be saved/loaded
members.name: data_dir

members.name: stabilization_hits

members.description: Amound of initial observations necessary to first neural network training. If zero or negative, the default initial observation value will be used.
members.name: initial_required_observations

members.description: Desired mean squared error. It's the difference between the estimator and what is estimated. The neural network will try to reach this value. Higher values can be reached easily, requiring less time and processing on training phase. Also, it won't try to guess the output if the desired mse wasn't reached.
members.name: mse

members.description: Training algorithm to be used by the neural network. Supported algorithms are: 'rprop' - resilient backpropagation, and 'quickprop' - discrete pseudo-Newton method.
members.name: training_algorithm

members.default: sigmoid sigmoid_symmetric gaussian gaussian_symmetric elliot elliot_symmetric cos cos_symmetric sin sin_symmetric
members.description: Activation functions that may be used for neural network. It'll try to use all of these functions to get the best one for its observations. Supported activation functions are: sigmoid sigmoid_symmetric gaussian gaussian_symmetric elliot elliot_symmetric cos cos_symmetric sin sin_symmetric. It's possible to set more than one, separeted by space. By default all of them are considered candidates. Reducing this set will reduce processing on training phase.
